垃圾球證
The LFP have confirmed the referees for this week's Copa del Rey quarterfinal first leg games. And the choise for Real Sociedad's game against Barcelona may put more than a few people on alert. The chosen official is José Luis González González, who doesn't have fond memories of Barça matches in the past.

Exactly one year ago González González took charge of the Catalan derby between Espanyol and Barça at Cornella-El Prat. The Blaugrana complained that he had allowed the home side to get away with playing dirty. The game ended goalless and it provoked a fiery run of fixtures between the two local rivals.

González González went into that Barcelona derby after refereeing an intense game between Real Madrid and Real Sociedad when he awarded two controversial penalties.

And two weeks later, when González González was again chosen for a Barcelona game, this time the Copa del Rey quarterfinal against Athletic Club, Luis Enrique showed his surprise, hardly able to hide his disgust at the decision. Even though they won the game and then the tie, Barça were not satisifed with the official's performance at San Mames.

Now, he will once again referee Barça in an imporant cup game one year later.

拉B
Ivan Rakitic has paid tribute to Luis Enrique for bringing him to Barcelona and hailed the influence of club legend Xavi.

Rakitic, 28, was one of the players Luis Enrique asked the club to sign when the former Barca player was appointed first-team boss in 2014.

The Croatia international has helped the Blaugrana to back-to-back domestic doubles and a UEFA Champions League title, though he has dropped down the pecking order this season and has made only 10 La Liga starts and has not been in the first XI in the league since the Clasico defeat to Real Madrid.

But Rakitic told France Football his current coach has still been a major factor in his development.

"Luis Enrique has helped me enormously," Rakitic said. "He gave me confidence straight away, as did my teammates, which enabled me to work calmly.
"It's the 'Mister' who asked the club to sign me. If I had to throw myself off a bridge for him, I would do it without hesitation. With a look or a smile, he gives you the confidence necessary to succeed."

Rakitic's arrival helped Barca handle the transition in midfield as Xavi left the club, with the two players spending one season together at the Camp Nou before the Spain international left to play for Al Sadd in Qatar.

Xavi's influence is still felt on and off the pitch, however, through the lasting impression he made on Rakitic.

"Xavi gave me a lot. I have just two words to say to him, 'Thank you,'" Rakitic added. "The only thing I regret is to have played just a single season with him.

"I learned so much from on and off the pitch, during our away trips, in the dressing-room. I took advantage of every moment by his side during that season. What Xavi gave this club, his teammates and the fans is unique."

山狗大戰

Granada's situation in La Liga, is not good. They are six points from getting out of the relegation zone and, one game short of completing the first half of the season, they have only recorded on victory. Dspite the worrying dynamic, the season has been positive for Sergi Samper on a personal level. Above all, in recent weeks, the midfielder has become a fixture in the starting team. The Barcelona man, on loan, hopes that his ticket is a return one, and his dream is to triumph at Barcelona in the future. That's why he snubbed Arsenal.

Samper is the first Barcelona player to arrive in the first team after passing for each and every youth football level, and he is spending his first season in the top flight with a clear objective: to shine and gain the maturity necessary to have a place in the Barcelona squad next season. It's likely Samper will reach 1,000 minutes played this week against Espanyol, a number that really started to grow after Lucas Alcaraz took over in October.

Speaking to Granada's website, he said: "I did not want to listen to [Arsene] Wenger. I told him clearly that I wanted to stay, I wanted to succeed at Barcelona, that I was a big cule, and what would make me happy was succeeding at Barcelona in the future."

Samper added: "I feel important in the team. I am enjoying where I am and I hope that we can change the situation."
